item.title: Statisticians have determined the safest hideout for a zombie apocalypse
item.description:
Statisticians have determined the safest hideout for a zombie apocalypse

I have long had an obsession with the Zombie genre. So it is just natural to think about my own exit strategy in case of a pending "omega-day". The articleÂ mentioned that the best chance for survival is, to get out of the major cities and off to the country-side.

item.title: These photos Apple's first employees showed us from the company's earliest days are absolutely wonderful
item.description:
These photos Apple's first employees showed us from the company's earliest days are absolutely wonderful

The year was 1977. Steve Jobs and Steve Wozniak had barely moved out of the Jobs' family garage to the company's first official corporate address, 20863 Stevens Creek Blvd., (Building 3, Suite C) in Cupertino, Calif. The pair had successfully begun shipping their first computer, a naked circuit board called Apple I.

item.title: Life and Death in the App Store
item.description:
Life and Death in the App Store

As last year began, the app developer Pixite held its company retreat at a converted Old West movie set outside of Palm Springs. They spent a few days dreaming about the future while eating barbecue and sipping whisky in the sun. But 2015 was not a good year, and by last month the company's dreams had narrowed to survival.

item.title: A new typeface, designed by algorithms instead of by hand
item.description:
A new typeface, designed by algorithms instead of by hand

Methods of type design have shifted over the years - from moveable type printing presses to copper plate engraving to modern design software - but fonts are still largely created by hand. And with globally successful fonts containing nearly 600 characters in various languages, a single typeface with several weights and styles can take a year or more to design.

item.title: How holograms can help NASA explore Mars
item.description:
How holograms can help NASA explore Mars

Ops Lab is in charge of building systems for controlling robots and spacecraft at NASA's Jet Propulsion. Some of their projects include controlling articulating arms, building immersive environments, and controlling robots like Robonaut 2 and Athlete using technology like the Oculus Rift and a Kinect sensor.
